1.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a stated assemblage (specifically, a concourse, or generally, a family or crowd)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
to reside or permanently stay (literally or figuratively)
there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a tent (as clearly conspicuous from a distance)

properly, an appointment, i.e. a fixed time or season; specifically, a festival; conventionally ayear; by implication, an assembly (as convened for a definite purpose); technically the congregation; by extension, the place of meeting; also a signal (as appointed beforehand)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
to tread down; hence, negatively, to disregard; positively, to conquer, subjugate, violate
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

2.brief: to jut over or exceed; by implication, to excel; (intransitively) to remain or be left; causatively, to leave, cause to abound, preserve
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be smooth (figuratively); by implication (as smooth stones were used for lots) to apportion or separate
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
properly, something inherited, i.e. (abstractly) occupancy, or (concretely) an heirloom; generally an estate, patrimony or portion
seven (as the sacred full one); also (adverbially) seven times; by implication, a week; by extension, an indefinite number
a scion, i.e. (literally) a stick (for punishing, writing, fighting, ruling, walking, etc.) or (figuratively) a clan

3.brief: near, with or among; often in general, to
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
where?; hence, whither?, when?; also hither and thither
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
to slacken (in many applications, literal or figurative)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
to occupy (by driving out previous tenants, and possessing in their place); by implication, to seize, to rob, to inherit; also to expel, to impoverish, to ruin
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application

the front, of place (absolutely, the fore part, relatively the East) or time (antiquity); often used adverbially (before, anciently, eastward)
properly, something inherited, i.e. (abstractly) occupancy, or (concretely) an heirloom; generally an estate, patrimony or portion
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Binjamin, youngest son of Jacob; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory
(as noun) a circle, neighbour, or environs; but chiefly (as adverb, with or without preposition) around
a family, i.e. circle of relatives; figuratively, a class (of persons), a species (of animals) or sort (of things); by extension a tribe or people

21.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)

a branch (as extending); figuratively, a tribe; also a rod, whether for chastising (figuratively, correction), ruling (a sceptre), throwing (a lance), or walking (a staff; figuratively, a support of life, e.g. bread)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Binjamin, youngest son of Jacob; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory
a family, i.e. circle of relatives; figuratively, a class (of persons), a species (of animals) or sort (of things); by extension a tribe or people
Jericho or Jerecho, a place in Palestine

23.brief: Avvim (as inhabited by Avvites), a place in Palestine (with the article prefix)
Ophrah, the name of an Israelite and of two places in Palestine

24.brief: an Ophnite (collectively) or inhabitants of Ophen
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
a yard (as inclosed by a fence); also a hamlet (as similarly surrounded with walls)

25.brief: Ramah, the name of four places in Palestine

26.brief: Mitspeh, the name of five places in Palestine

27.brief: Rekem, the name of a place in Palestine, also of a Midianite and an Israelite

28.brief: a Jebusite or inhabitant of Jebus

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
Kirjath-Jearim or Kirjath-Arim, a place in Palestine
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
a yard (as inclosed by a fence); also a hamlet (as similarly surrounded with walls)
